A popular example is âBetter Placeâ, a global provider of electric vehicle networks and services that works in a joint venture with Renault Nissan Alliance Motor Company to promote the use of electric cars.<ref name="http://www.betterplace.com">[http://www.betterplace.com Better Place | The Global Provider of EV Networks and Services<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The founder, Shai Agassi, was intrigued by a question posed at the World Economic Forum in 2005 "How do you make the world a better place by 2020?". <ref name="http://www.copenhagenclimatecouncil.com/about-us/councillors/shai-agassi.html">[http://www.copenhagenclimatecouncil.com/about-us/councillors/shai-agassi.html Copenhagen Climate Council<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
A popular example is âBetter Placeâ, a global provider of electric vehicle networks and services that works in a joint venture with Renault Nissan Alliance Motor Company to promote the use of electric cars.<ref name="http://www.betterplace.com">[http://www.betterplace.com Better Place | The Global Provider of EV Networks and Services<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The founder, Shai Agassi, was intrigued by a question posed at the World Economic Forum in 2005 "How do you make the world a better place by 2020?". <ref name="http://www.copenhagenclimatecouncil.com/about-us/councillors/shai-agassi.html">[http://www.copenhagenclimatecouncil.com/about-us/councillors/shai-agassi.html Copenhagen Climate Council<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Thus the name Better Place. It is not related to the product (electric vehicle) but to much wider social and ecological issues (depletion of natural resources, CO2 emissionsâ¦), which the company addresses or rather offers the solution for.
Thus the name Better Place. It is not related to the product (electric vehicle) but to much wider social and ecological issues (depletion of natural resources, CO2 emissionsâ¦), which the company addresses or rather offers the solution for.

[[File:Logo better place.png|thumb|right|Logo Better Place]]
  â
 
Sustainability brand names can be part of a new product launch, an extension to an existing (conventional) brand or be so new to the market that they create a product category themselves. Each of these approaches has specific strategic implications.
Sustainability brand names can be part of a new product launch, an extension to an existing (conventional) brand or be so new to the market that they create a product category themselves. Each of these approaches has specific strategic implications.
